lsmr.vendingmachine.simulator

Class CoinRackSimulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • lsmr.vendingmachine.simulator.AbstractHardware<CoinRackListener>
      • lsmr.vendingmachine.simulator.CoinRackSimulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractCoinAcceptor

    public class CoinRackSimulator
extends AbstractHardware<CoinRackListener>
implements AbstractCoinAcceptor
    Represents a device that stores coins of a particular denomination to dispense them as change.

    Coin racks can receive coins from other sources. To simplify the simulation, no check is performed on the value of each coin, meaning it is an external responsibility to ensure the correct routing of coins.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoinRackSimulator

        public CoinRackSimulator(int capacity)
        Creates a coin rack with the indicated maximum capacity.
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if capacity is not positive.

    • Method Detail

      • acceptCoin

        public void acceptCoin(Coin coin)
                throws CapacityExceededException,
                       DisabledException
        Causes the indicated coin to be added into the rack. If successful, a "coinAdded" event is announced to its listeners. If a successful coin addition causes the rack to become full, a "coinsFull" event is announced to its listeners.
        Specified by:
        acceptCoin in interface AbstractCoinAcceptor
        Parameters:
        coin - The coin to be taken as input.
        Throws:
        DisabledException - if the coin rack is currently disabled.
        CapacityExceededException - if the coin rack is already full.

      • connect

        public void connect(CoinChannelSimulator sink)
        Connects an output channel to this coin rack. Any existing output channels are disconnected. Causes no events to be announced.

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the maximum capacity of this coin rack.

      • hasSpace

        public boolean hasSpace()
        Returns whether this coin rack has enough space to accept at least one more coin. Announces no events.
        Specified by:
        hasSpace in interface AbstractCoinAcceptor
        Returns:
        true if there is space, false if there is not space

      • loadWithoutEvents

        public void loadWithoutEvents(Coin... coins)
                       throws SimulationException
        Allows a set of coins to be loaded into the rack without events being announced. Existing coins in the rack are not removed.
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if the number of coins to be loaded exceeds the capacity of the rack.

      • releaseCoin

        public void releaseCoin()
                 throws CapacityExceededException,
                        EmptyException,
                        DisabledException
        Releases a single coin from this coin rack. If successful, a "coinRemoved" event is announced to its listeners. If a successful coin removal causes the rack to become empty, a "coinsEmpty" event is announced to its listeners.
        Throws:
        CapacityExceededException - if the output channel is unable to accept another coin.
        EmptyException - if no coins are present in the rack to release.
        DisabledException - if the rack is currently disabled.
